description.narrative: The aim is to improve national technical and institutional capacities for the planning, implementation and monitoring the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) within central line ministries, local governments and civil society organizations (CSOs).

participating-org.narrative: MPTFO - Joint SDG Fund (previously known as The Joint Fund for the 2030 Agenda)

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: MPTFO - Joint SDG Fund (previously known as The Joint Fund for the 2030 Agenda)

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
2018 1.1 # of Iraqi stakeholders from national and local governments, civil society, academia participating in and benefiting of SDG-NDP awareness raising events [disaggregated by sex and age). 1.2 SDG and National Development Plan (NDP) communication strategy developed and implemented 1.3 Availability of a revised version of the NDP (2018-2022) that integrates nationalized SDGs and indicators
2.1 # broad based multi-stakeholder (government, civil society, private sector, academia) consultations and capacity development sessions on Gender, Governance and Peace Building and environment mainstreaming issues 2.2 # Awareness-raising sessions conducted at national/subnational level on the importance of achieving environmental SDGs in Iraq for progress and sustainability of progress on other SDGs, particularly on the nexus between SDG 6,7, 13 and implications of environmental goals for other the SDGs 2.3 Completion of analytical report on SDG 5 and gender mainstreaming in NDP/SDG 2.4 Completion of analytical report on synergies between environmental SDGs and other global commitments produced 2.5 Availability of SDG Gender mainstreaming guidelines 2.6 Availability of governance and peace-building SDG mainstreaming guidelines 2.7 Relevant NDP/SDG TWGs are capacitated in the respective SDG area (gender, environment and Governance and peace building). 2.8 The development and implementation of strategy for information management, communication and advocacy on environmental SDGs 2.9 # of experts and Officials trained on integrated modelling (gender disaggregated)
3.1 # of provinces with local development plans, aligned with SDGs/NDP Iraq vision and 2030 agenda in place 3.2 Local Committees for Sustainable Development (LCSD) are capacitated on data collection and analysis to develop thematic annual reports in their respective SDG areas 3.3 Four pilot provincial SDG Reports produced
4.1 Data availability assessment at national and sub-national level is completed and ecosystem

comment.narrative:
2018 Output 1: Institutional and analytical capacity for aligning national planning and monitoring frameworks with SDGs strengthened 1.1 One national level Awareness raising workshops was conducted at national level in March 2018. 1.2 There is no SDG and National Development Plan (NDP) communication strategy developed and implemented. 1.3 No systematic alignment exercise undertaken.
Output 2: Analytical capacities for integrated approaches to SDG based planning (with focus on mainstreaming of gender, Environmental sustainability and Governance and peace) strengthened 2.1 there is no broad-based multi-stakeholder (government, civil society, private sector, academia) consultations and capacity development sessions on Gender, Governance and Peace Building and environment mainstreaming issues 2.2 A technical group has been established to facilitate coordinated support to implement environmental SDGs in Iraq 2.3 there is no completed analytical report on SDG 5 and gender mainstreaming in NDP/SDG 2.4 GoI readiness on environmental SDGs are in advance stage 2.5 there are no guidelines Available for SDG Gender mainstreaming 2.6 there are no guidelines Available for governance and peace-building SDG mainstreaming 2.7 Weak on SDG 5 and 16 but GoI’s readiness on environmental SDGs are at an advance stage 2.8 A technical working group for Environmental SDGs established 2.9 no training had been conducted for experts and Officials on integrated modelling (gender disaggregated)
Output 3: Capacity development for SDG localization strengthened 3.1 4 provinces have either developed or in the process of developing Local Development Plan (LDP) 3.2 No provincial SDG Report produced
Output 4: Capacities for integrated SDG Monitoring and Reporting at national and local levels strengthened 4.1 A team is working on availability of indicators for SDG monitoring 4.2 there is no report on a standalone review/brief on SDG data disaggregation gaps and needs (looking at both sex disaggreg

Output 1: Institutional and analytical capacity for aligning national planning and monitoring frameworks with SDGs strengthened. - 100 of Iraqi stakeholders from national and local governments, civil society, academia benefiting from Iraqi National SDGs Forum [disaggregated by sex and age). - SDG and NDP Communication strategy is developed
Output 2: Analytical capacities for integrated approaches to SDG based planning (with focus on mainstreaming of gender, Environmental sustainability and Governance and peace) strengthened. - One of broad based multi-stakeholder government, civil society, private sector, academia) consultations and capacity development sessions on Gender, Governance and Peace Building and environment mainstreaming issues were organized. At least one consultation organized on each of the three themes.
Output 3: Capacity development for SDG localization strengthened - 4 of provinces with local development plans, aligned with SDGs/NDP Iraq vision and 2030 agenda in place - Local Committees for Sustainable Development (LCSD) are capacitated on collecting data on localization of SDGs in national and sub-national plans - Two pilot provincial SDG reports
Output 4: Capacities for integrated SDG Monitoring and Reporting at national and local levels strengthened. - Data availability assessment is completed, and Data Ecosystem Mapping Report is produced - Training organized for provincial level (for ecologically vulnerable Governorates) - SDG online database and tracking system exists at national and local levels - One SDG National Reports ready for dissemination - Data dissemination platform is established and functioning

Output 1: Institutional and analytical capacity for aligning national planning and monitoring frameworks with SDGs strengthened. - Initial discussions on the national SDG Forum has been started in late 2020 between the SDGs teams at UNDP and MOP. So, it will be established by 2021. - SDG and NDP Communication strategy has been developed and put in place cooperatively with MOP.
Output 2: Analytical capacities for integrated approaches to SDG based planning (with focus on mainstreaming of gender, Environmental sustainability and Governance and peace) strengthened. - 6 of broad based multi-stakeholder government, civil society, private sector, academia) consultations and capacity development sessions on Gender, Governance and Peace Building and environment mainstreaming issues were organized.
Output 3: Capacity development for SDG localization strengthened - Because of COVID-19, the work with local level has been postponed to 2021 as per the decision of the governmental authorities. - More than 8 local Committees for Sustainable Development (LCSD) are capacitated on collecting data on localization of SDGs in national and sub-national plans
Output 4: Capacities for integrated SDG Monitoring and Reporting at national and local levels strengthened. - Data availability assessment is completed, and Data Ecosystem Mapping Report is available for dissemination - 7 trainings organized for provincial level (for ecologically vulnerable Governorates) - SDG online database and tracking system exists at national and local levels - The work on the SDG National Reports has been started but not completed yet due to COVID-19 pandemic restrictions - Data dissemination platform is established and functioning

Output 1: Institutional and analytical capacity for aligning national planning and monitoring frameworks with SDGs strengthened. - 200 of Iraqi stakeholders from national and local governments, civil society, academia benefiting from Iraqi National SDGs Forum [disaggregated by sex and age).
Output 2: Analytical capacities for integrated approaches to SDG based planning (with focus on mainstreaming of gender, Environmental sustainability and Governance and peace) strengthened. - 8 Gender and Governance and peace sessions are organized. At least one consultation organized on each of the three themes. - One analytical report on SDG 5 and gender mainstreaming guidelines. - 100 of Relevant NDP/SDG TWGs capacitated in the respective SDG area (gender, environment and Governance and peace building) per year.
Output 3: Capacity development for SDG localization strengthened - Two pilot provincial SDG reports are put in place.
Output 4: Capacities for integrated SDG Monitoring and Reporting at national and local levels strengthened. - Data availability assessment is completed, and Data Ecosystem Mapping Report is available. - One M&E framework for tracking and reporting on the progress of environmental SDGs is in place for implementation. - VNR report is completed and submitted for presentation at 2019 HLPF.

Output 1: Institutional and analytical capacity for aligning national planning and monitoring frameworks with SDGs strengthened. - More than 200 from different sectors including government, private, and CSOs were participated in and benefited from raising awareness sessions.
Output 2: Analytical capacities for integrated approaches to SDG based planning (with focus on mainstreaming of gender, Environmental sustainability and Governance and peace) strengthened. - Six gender and governance and peace sessions were organized. - An analytical report on SDG 5 and gender mainstreaming is available. - More than 100 of relevant NDP/SDG TWGs were capacitied in the respective SDG area (gender, environment and Governance and peace building) per year.
Output 3: Capacity development for SDG localization strengthened - Three pilot provincial SDG reports are putted in place.
Output 4: Capacities for integrated SDG Monitoring and Reporting at national and local levels strengthened. - A technical session of SDGs data collection and analysis methodologies was organized for both national and sub-national sustainable development committees and statistics departments. - A M&E framework for tracking and reporting on the progress of the SDGs is in place at both national and sub-national levels. - VNR report is completed, submitted, and presented at 2019 HLPF.

Output 1: Institutional and analytical capacity for aligning national planning and monitoring frameworks with SDGs strengthened. - 1000 of Iraqi stakeholders from national and local governments, civil society, academia benefiting from Iraqi National SDGs Forum [disaggregated by sex and age). - One technical workshops organized on enhancing the capacity of the gender units’ and women offices in governorates on SDGs alignment with gender related international conventions and resolutions
Output 2: Analytical capacities for integrated approaches to SDG based planning (with focus on mainstreaming of gender, Environmental sustainability and Governance and peace) strengthened. - 3 multi-stakeholder government, civil society, private sector, academia) consultations and capacity development sessions on Gender, Governance and Peace Building and environment mainstreaming issues were organized.
Output 3: Capacity development for SDG localization strengthened - One pilot local governorates have developed their SDGs vision which aligned with the 2030 agenda and the Iraq Vision 2030
Output 4: Capacities for integrated SDG Monitoring and Reporting at national and local levels strengthened. - SDGs financial gap assessment is available - The COVID-19 plan developed and submitted for the Government to be adopted - 2nd Iraq VNR is developed and submitted for HLPF 2021 - 5 SDG Reports produced at national, regional and sub-national levels

Output 1: Institutional and analytical capacity for aligning national planning and monitoring frameworks with SDGs strengthened. - Results: 1000 of Iraqi stakeholders from national and local governments, civil society, academia benefited from SDGs awareness raising sessions[disaggregated by sex and age). - Results: Two technical workshops organized on enhancing the capacity of the gender units’ and women offices in governorates on SDGs alignment with gender related international conventions and resolutions - Results:
Output 2: Analytical capacities for integrated approaches to SDG based planning (with focus on mainstreaming of gender, Environmental sustainability and Governance and peace) strengthened. - Results: 3 multi-stakeholder government, civil society, private sector, academia) consultations and capacity development sessions on Gender, Governance and Peace Building and environment mainstreaming issues were organized.
Output 3: Capacity development for SDG localization strengthened - Results: KRI Vision 2030 has been developed.
Output 4: Capacities for integrated SDG Monitoring and Reporting at national and local levels strengthened. - Results: The COVID-19 plan developed and adopted by the Government - Results: 2nd Iraq VNR is developed and submitted for HLPF 2021
